medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Abdominal pain developed one day before admission in the right upper quadrant; it was sharp, constant, worsened by movement and deep breathing. The pain progressively worsened over the next 24 hours. The patient had also experienced ongoing rash, which began two years before admission, and lymphadenopathy, first detected in the neck four years prior. The rash evolved into hyperpigmented nodules. The patient noted weight loss of 4.5 kg over the past year, attributed to increased exercise, but stopped exercising due to increased fatigue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Microcytic anemia attributed to Î²-thalassemia minor.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's father died of complications of emphysema.
medical_history.social_history: The patient was born in Morocco, moved to the USA 10 years prior, and visits his family in rural Morocco every few years. He has never smoked tobacco, does not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs, and does not consume unpasteurized dairy products.
